articles.title: ITCZ, easterlies to continue to affect PH
articles.description: MANILA – The Intertropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ) and the easterlies will continue to affect the country, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) said on Sunday. In its 5 a.m. bulletin, the weather bureau said Mindanao and the eastern section of…
articles.content:
MANILA – The Intertropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ) and the easterlies will continue to affect the country, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) said on Sunday.

articles.title: Trump hosts military parade as protesters rally across US against his presidency
articles.description: The president celebrates the 250th anniversary of the US Army as demonstrators hold "No Kings" events from coast to coast.
articles.content:
Event has feeling of a Trump campaign rally
Bernd Debusmann Jr
Reporting from Washington DC
I covered the Trump 2024 campaign at length - and this event, while officially a celebration of the Army, has very much the same atmosphere as a Trump rally.
... [580 chars]

articles.title: Rain likely as heatwave eases
articles.description: Dust storms forecast for Lahore, Multan, Bahawalpur, Faisalabad
articles.content:
Widespread dust storms and scattered rain are expected across much of upper and central Punjab this weekend, bringing temporary relief from the intense heat that has gripped the region in recent weeks.

articles.title: Two Democrat politicians killed in their Minnesota homes
articles.description: A large-scale manhunt is under way for a suspect who posed as a police officer to shoot and kill a lawmaker and her husband in their home, while wounding two others.
articles.content:
Washington: Two Democratic politicians in the US state of Minnesota have been shot in their homes in the middle of the night – one of them fatally, along with her husband – with police conducting a large-scale manhunt for the assassin.

articles.title: In 1st address to US, Pope Leo sends message of hope from White Sox stadium
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV will make a virtual appearance in his hometown Saturday in his first address to U.S. audiences since he was elected pope.
articles.content:
The event began with two national anthems, one from Peru and one from the U.S.

articles.title: HIGHLIGHTS: George Russell snatches Canadian Grand Prix pole ahead of Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri
articles.description: George Russell claimed his first pole position of the 2025 season for the Canadian Grand Prix, pipping Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri to top spot.
articles.content:
George Russell claimed his first pole position of the 2025 season for the Canadian Grand Prix, pipping Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri to top spot.
The Mercedes driver posted a 1m 10.899s with his final effort, leaving him 0.160s clear of Verstappen... [647 chars]

articles.title: Cliff rescue of Melbourne woman was NSW PolAir team's most complex yet
articles.description: When Hyun Park slipped while climbing in the Warrumbungles, her life depended on her 80-year-old mentor and the tactical gymnastics of a 20-hour overnight rescue mission.
articles.content:
Hyun Park dangled, unconscious, almost 200 metres above rugged bushland in western New South Wales, on the climbing ropes that had stopped her from plummeting to the ground.
Moments earlier, she had slipped while leading the fourth pitch of a 250-met... [15155 chars]

articles.title: Philly attracts thousands to 'No Kings' protest against Trump
articles.description: Organizers designated Philadelphia as the lead city in a movement spanning the nation, with over 2,000 protests planned.
articles.content:
Mike Madera, 28, of West Philadelphia, joined a pro-Palestine contingent of the protest. He said he has been working to support people in Gaza since the Israel-Hamas war began in October 2023.
“There is no ‘progressive’ … without Palestine,” he said.... [2619 chars]
